text.text: Extension In Due Date Of Fee Vouchers

text: Due to Connectivity issues, students are informed that due date of fee vouchers which were due on December 04, 2020 or December 05, 2020 has been extended till

text.text: On issues and bugs in the new version of LMS

text: Recently, Virtual University of Pakistan launched a new version of LMS with a new user interface and intuitive features. However, some functionality and features have been presented differently for ease of use and student activity tracking. Like any new version of a software some features are liked by users and others take time getting used to.

text.text: The ICT teams are actively looking into any complaints and evaluating feedback in order to make it even better and more functional.
some miscreants started generating severe BruteForce and DDoS cyber-attacks on LMS to make it inaccessible

text:
for obvious reasons. The ICT teams are continuously taking measures to mitigate these attacks on our websites and will not rest till the issue is resolved. We regret the inconvenience caused and appreciate your patience.

The University authorities have identified these sources and gathered the requisite information, which is now being sent to FIA Cyber Crimes wing for further action against these culprits.

Furthermore, to compensate students with their graded activities the university extended the deadlines for different graded activities as deemed appropriate, so that students could make their submissions.

text.text: VU Cisco Network Academy is starting a new batch

text:
VU Cisco Network Academy is starting a new batch of the following courses.

1. Network Essentials
2. Introduction to Internet of Things (IoT)

These are basic courses, but it will open the doors to several highly valuable certifications. This is just the first step to a whole new dimension of IT related courses.

So, don’t miss the opportunity and get yourself enrolled in the courses and get an internationally recognized certificate.

for registration.

text.text: Postgraduate Students : Submit your Migration Certificate

text:
from the last Pakistani institute/university attended to the office of the Registrar within 6 weeks of issuance of their admission offer letter. 
Submit the same on or before

Please note the following:

1. Photocopy/color copy/scanned copy of Migration Certificate is unacceptable.
2. (a) Campus based students may submit the said certificate to their respective campus and obtain receipt.
2. (b) Home based/overseas students may send directly to VU Head Office address.
3. VU ID must be clearly mentioned on top right corner of the migration certificate.
